answers.answer: HiThanks for writing to the forum!Your symptoms could be due to several causes. Diuretics, given for high blood pressure can pose this problem. It can also be due to overactive bladder syndrome, urinary incontinence, prostatitis, interstitial cystitis or even cancer. STDs too cause similar problems. Diabetes insipidus too can present this way with increased frequency of urination.You need a comprehensive investigation taking all these points in consideration. Please discuss this with your doctor and get yourself investigated accordingly. Please let me know if there is any thing else and do keep me posted. Take care!

question: hi, i'm a 19 year old female and lately i've been having a problem with frequent urination. it always feels like i have to go and it seems like i am producing more urine than usual, especially for having to go every few minutes.  i do have a family history of diabetes, i have been tested for it several times, all negative.  i'm not excessively thirsty, though i do tend to not drink enough fluids.  i sometimes feel nauseous and tired and have recently began to lose my appetite.  i'm sexually active and sometimes, right after having sex, i felt like i really had to go to the bathroom, even though i didn't urinate much then.  i was wondering if this was something i needed to go to the doctor for?  thanks for your help!
title: frequent urination
